45:59 Caption: Well, a decent first half here. It's certainly not boring, but not the best match either. The away side is controlling this game. The home team's main priority is a flawless defence, while the away side's style is slow build-up play.

49:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. The Bayern Munich fans must be pleased with the performance of their team. They were absolutely the better of the two sides. It's obvious that defence had the highest priority for the home side. The away team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an enthralling encounter at the Karaiskakis Stadium, Bayern Munich emerged victorious with a convincing 3-0 win over Olympiakos Piraeus. The game showcased the tactical prowess of the German giants and the resilience of the home team, albeit in a losing effort. From the first whistle, the match was brimming with intensity and drama.

The match kicked off with Olympiakos Piraeus taking the centre stage, but the early minutes were marred by several stoppages. Within the first minute, the ball was out of play multiple times, indicating an initial struggle from both sides to settle into the rhythm of the game. The first real attempt to generate momentum came in the 3rd minute when Olympiakos had a shot off target, but Bayern quickly responded by maintaining possession and pushing forward.

In the early exchanges, Olympiakos seemed set on physical play as they committed several fouls, with their aggressive approach costing them dearly. By the 5th minute, they had already received a yellow card for a foul, signaling the referee's intention to keep the game within control. Despite this, Olympiakos did manage to create chances; in the 7th minute, they secured a corner, leading to a shot on target which was comfortably saved by Bayern's goalkeeper, Manuel Neuer.

Bayern Munich, known for their controlled and measured build-up play, were patient and methodical in their approach. They seized their opportunities well, with a notable save from Neuer in the 10th minute denying a long-range effort from Alejandro Dominguez, a clear reminder of the German's defensive solidity. Moments later, Bayern began probing deeper into Olympiakos' territory. Thiago Alcantara and Douglas Costa were pivotal in their midfield, often creating play and trying to find gaps in the Olympiakos defense.

By the 18th minute, Bayern had their first significant chance from a corner, but it was adeptly cleared by Roberto Jimenez, the Olympiakos goalkeeper. Bayern kept the pressure on and managed to catch Olympiakos offside multiple times, with one such instance occurring around the 21st minute when Lewandowski was flagged, halting their attack.

As the first half progressed, the physicality of Olympiakos became more evident. The Greek team's persistent fouling resulted in two more players being booked by the 25th minute. This played into Bayern's hands as it disrupted Olympiakos' momentum and afforded Bayern chances to capitalize on set-pieces. A notable opportunity came off a free-kick around this time, but was ultimately cleared off the line.

Bayern intensified their dominance as the half progressed. A series of shots on target in the 33rd and 34th minutes forced Roberto Jimenez into multiple saves, showcasing his alertness and reflexes. The most remarkable perhaps was his actions in the 43rd minute when a driven header from Manuel da Costa was skillfully caught by Neuer.

Tensions flared shortly before the break when Thomas Muller received a yellow card for a tactical foul, curbing Olympiakos' final first-half assaults. As the first half came to an end, the score remained 0-0, but Bayern's superiority in ball possession and opportunities was apparent. They had crafted numerous chances and effectively stifled Olympiakos' attacks.

The second half commenced with Bayern picking up where they left off, dictating the pace from the onset. Within six minutes, their pressure paid off. Thomas Muller latched onto a loose ball outside the box and with an audacious attempt, sent it soaring into the top left corner of the net, leaving Roberto Jimenez with no chance. The goal injected further confidence into the Bayern ranks as they executed their game plan with heightened precision.

Olympiakos tried to respond immediately, but Neuer was once again on hand to thwart their efforts, denying Brown Ideye with a reflex save in the 10th minute. Despite their best efforts, Olympiakos struggled to penetrate Bayern's resolute defense effectively.

Bayern continued to rotate their squad, bringing on fresh legs in the form of Kingsley Coman and Mario Gotze. These substitutions added more dynamism to Bayern's attack. Coman, in particular, provided a new dimension with his pace and direct approach, which the tired limbs of Olympiakos' defense found hard to cope with.

Substitutions from Olympiakos did little to change the tide, although Hernani's inclusion saw a brief resurgence of attacking intent from the home side. Nevertheless, Bayern's structured defense and Neuer's brilliance kept Olympiakos at bay. 

The second goal came in the 44th minute when Kingsley Coman provided a well-weighted assist to Mario Gotze who slotted the ball home into the bottom left corner beyond Roberto Jimenez. This clinical finish underscored Bayern's attacking efficiency and effectively put the game beyond the reach of Olympiakos.

Just as the match seemed set for a 2-0 conclusion, an error in the dying moments led to Arthur Masuaku conceding a penalty. Thomas Muller stepped up and confidently dispatched the spot-kick, sealing Bayern's 3-0 victory. Muller’s penalty was a testament to his composure and clinical finishing, ensuring a comprehensive scoreline.

The final moments of the game saw Douglas Costa coming close with a volley just outside the box, encapsulating Bayern's relentless pursuit for goals until the very end. The referee soon blew the whistle to signal full time, bringing the match to a close.

Overall, Bayern Munich’s performance was a masterclass in tactical superiority, disciplined defending, and clinical finishing. The midfield combination of Thiago Alcantara and Xabi Alonso controlled the tempo, while the forward line, led by Muller and supported by Costa and Lewandowski, proved too hot for Olympiakos to handle. For Olympiakos, the match was a sobering experience as they found themselves outclassed, but they can take heart from some spirited defending and notable saves by Roberto Jimenez.

The crowd of 31,688 witnessed a commanding display from Bayern Munich, who thoroughly deserved their win and maintained their strong run in the competition. Their fans will undoubtedly be pleased with the team's form and their ability to execute Pep Guardiola's strategies to perfection. The match highlighted Bayern's depth, resilience, and their relentless quest for success on the European stage.
